messages.message: A little hiccup on comparisons - explicitly states 7798. Asked it to tell me why it was included.... answered that 7798>8000 so the transaction is included

GPT isn’t very good at math, so i don’t think we have a workaround for this

this kind of operation is very easy to do in Refiner if we already have the list of transactions from the document, which AI Hub can do
understood. being able to draw comparisons across numbers will be crucial for growth accounts and within our commercial product - whether in refiner or in AI Hub proper
cc @Rafal @vineeth for further suggestions when they’re back online

agree LLMs are not that good at math, but it seems to be very simple math so this error is somehow surprising

One thing which might cause this is the tendency of the LLMs to justify their own output (generated before), so if the model generated the mistake it might make it more probable to generate a ridiculous statement to justify it (7789>8000)

I think a prompt like
```Generate a list of transaction values together with a boolean value indicating if the value is larger than 8000. Use format [{"value": int, "larger_than_8000": bool}, ...]
```json```
would make it easier for the model, because first it needs to find the value of the transaction and right after make a comparison

also, we are working to enable tools usage like a calculator in our “Multi-step reasoning” feature so it should be easier to do math with AIHub
cc @Sławek Biel
